localized-strings.localized-string: Terms, definitions, symbols and abbreviated terms
No terms and definitions are listed in this document.

This document uses the terms defined in https://portal.ogc.org/public_ogc/directives/directives.php[OGC Policy Directive 49], which is based on the ISO/IEC Directives, Part 2, Rules for the structure and drafting of International Standards. In particular, the word “shall” (not “must”) is the verb form used to indicate a requirement to be strictly followed to conform to this document and OGC documents do not use the equivalent phrases in the ISO/IEC Directives, Part 2.
This document also uses terms defined in the OGC Standard for Modular specifications (https://portal.opengeospatial.org/files/?artifact_id=34762[OGC 08-131r3]), also known as the 'ModSpec'. The definitions of terms such as standard, specification, requirement, and conformance test are provided in the ModSpec.
For the purposes of this document, the following additional terms and definitions apply.

The following documents are referred to in the text in such a way that some or all of their content constitutes requirements of this document. For dated references, only the edition cited applies. For undated references, the latest edition of the referenced document (including any amendments) applies.
There are no normative references in this document.

In particular, the word “shall” (not “must”) is the verb form used to indicate a requirement to be strictly followed to conform to this document and OGC documents do not use the equivalent phrases in the ISO/IEC Directives, Part 2.
This document also uses terms defined in the OGC Standard for Modular specifications (https://portal.opengeospatial.org/files/?artifact_id=34762[OGC 08-131r3]), also known as the 'ModSpec'. The definitions of terms such as standard, specification, requirement, and conformance test are provided in the ModSpec.
For the purposes of this document, the terms and definitions given in % additionally apply.

In particular, the word “shall” (not “must”) is the verb form used to indicate a requirement to be strictly followed to conform to this document and OGC documents do not use the equivalent phrases in the ISO/IEC Directives, Part 2.
This document also uses terms defined in the OGC Standard for Modular specifications (https://portal.opengeospatial.org/files/?artifact_id=34762[OGC 08-131r3]), also known as the 'ModSpec'. semantic__note.semantic__p: Insert Preface Text here. Give OGC specific commentary: describe the technical content, reason for document, history of the document and precursors, and plans for future work.
There are two ways to specify the Preface: “simple clause” or “full clasuse”

If the Preface does not contain subclauses, it is considered a simple preface clause. This one is entered as text after the .Preface label and must be placed between the AsciiDoc document attributes and the first AsciiDoc section title. It should not be give a section title of its own.

If the Preface contains subclauses, it needs to be encoded as a full preface clause. This one is recognized as a full Metanorma AsciiDoc section with te title “Preface”, i.e. == Preface. (Simple preface content can also be encoded like full preface.)

semantic__clause.semantic__p: <Insert Scope text here>Give the subject of the document and the aspects of that scope covered by the document.
<Insert conformance content here>Provide a short description of the content approached in subsequent sections and the main subject of the document

semantic__terms.semantic__p: This document uses the terms defined in OGC Policy Directive 49, which is based on the ISO/IEC Directives, Part 2, Rules for the structure and drafting of International Standards. In particular, the word “shall” (not “must”) is the verb form used to indicate a requirement to be strictly followed to conform to this document and OGC documents do not use the equivalent phrases in the ISO/IEC Directives, Part 2.

This document also uses terms defined in the OGC Standard for Modular specifications (OGC 08-131r3), also known as the ‘ModSpec’. The definitions of terms such as standard, specification, requirement, and conformance test are provided in the ModSpec.
For the purposes of this document, the following additional terms and definitions apply.

semantic__termexample.semantic__p: Here’s an example of an example term.

semantic__note.semantic__p: This section provides details and examples for any conventions used in the document. Examples of conventions are symbols, abbreviations, use of XML schema, or special notes regarding how to read the document.

semantic__clause.semantic__p: The normative provisions in this standard are denoted by the URI
All requirements and conformance tests that appear in this document are denoted by partial URIs which are relative to this base.
<Place any other convention needed with its corresponding title>
This clause establishes the Core Requirements class, with IRI /req/core, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, Core, with IRI /conf/core.
The class geosrs:geosrs:CoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
Set of axes that spans a given coordinate space and of mathematical rules for specifying how coordinates are to be assigned to points. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.2, table 17 and annex B.2.
The class geosrs:geosrs:CartesianCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
Coordinate system which gives the position of points relative to n mutually perpendicular axes. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 18.
The class geosrs:geosrs:EllipsoidalCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
Coordinate system which gives the position is specified by geodetic latitude, geodetic longitude and (in the three-dimensional case) ellipsoidal height. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 20.
The class geosrs:geosrs:LinearCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
One-dimensional coordinate system in which a linear feature forms the axis.
The class geosrs:geosrs:OrdinalCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
n-dimensional coordinate system in which every axis uses integers.
The class geosrs:geosrs:ParametricCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
One-dimensional coordinate system where the axis units are parameter values which are not inherently spatial.
The class geosrs:geosrs:PolarCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
Two-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by one distance coordinate and one angular coordinate.
The class geosrs:geosrs:SphericalCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
Three-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space with one distance measured from the origin and two angular coordinates
The class geosrs:geosrs:VerticalCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
One-dimensional coordinate system used for gravity related height or depth measurements. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 25.
The class geosrs:geosrs:CoordinateSystemAxis is defined by the following:
Axis relative to which a coordinate of a point is specified in a coordinate system. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.3, table 27 and annex B.2.2.
The class geosrs:geosrs:AreaOfUse is defined by the following:
The class geosrs:geosrs:CRS is defined by the following:

Depending on the spatial dimension of coordinates (1D, 2D, 3D), this piece of metadata is used for specifying the elements of definition associated to a given set of coordinates: its datum, its ellipsoid, its prime meridian, the type of coordinates (geocentric, geographic, projected,…​), the coordinates units of measure, when appropriate the cartographic projection used, the vertical coordinate reference system.
The class geosrs:geosrs:EngineeringCRS is defined by the following:
The class geosrs:geosrs:GeodeticCRS is defined by the following:
Coordinate reference system associated with a geodetic datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 8.2.2.a, table 10 and annex B.1.2.1.a.
The class geosrs:geosrs:GeographicCRS is defined by the following:
The class geosrs:geosrs:ProjectedCRS is defined by the following:
Coordinate reference system derived from a two-dimensional geodetic coordinate reference system by applying a map projection. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 8.2.3.b, table 11 and annex B.1.2.3.
The class geosrs:geosrs:SingleCRS is defined by the following:
Coordinate reference system consisting of one coordinate system and one datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 5.
The class geosrs:geosrs:SpatialReferenceSystem is defined by the following:
A reference system allowing the description of a position.
The class geosrs:geosrs:CoordinateOperation is defined by the following:

Mathematical operation on coordinates, based on one-to-one relationship, that changes coordinates from one coordinate reference system to another. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 11.1, table 42 and annex B.4.
The class geosrs:geosrs:SingleOperation is defined by the following:
A non concatenated coordinate operation. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 43.
The class geosrs:geosrs:Transformation is defined by the following:
Coordinate operation in which the two coordinate reference systems are based on different datums. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 44.
The class geosrs:geosrs:Conversion is defined by the following:
Coordinate operation in which both coordinate reference systems are based on the same datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 45 and annex B.4.2.
The class geosrs:geosrs:OperationMethod is defined by the following:
Method used to perform an operation on coordinates. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 48 and annex B.4.5.
The class geosrs:geosrs:OperationParameter is defined by the following:
Parameter used by a method to perform an operation on coordinates. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 52 and annex B.4.5.
The class geosrs:geosrs:OperationParameterValue is defined by the following:
Value of a parameter used by a method to perform an operation on coordinates. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 55.
The class geosrs:geosrs:Datum is defined by the following:
Parameter or set of parameters that define the position of the origin, the scale and the orientation of a coordinate system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.1, table 33 and annex B.3.
The class geosrs:geosrs:GeodeticDatum is defined by the following:
Datum describing the relation of a two- or three-dimensional coordinate system to the Earth. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.2, table 34 and annex B.3.2.
The class geosrs:geosrs:PrimeMeridian is defined by the following:
Meridian from which the longitudes of other meridians are quantified. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.2.1, table 35 and annex B.3.2.2.
The class geosrs:geosrs:Ellipsoid is defined by the following:

Surface formed by the rotation of an ellipse about its minor axis, defined by a semi-major axis and a flattening parameter and fairly geocentric. NB : It is a mathematical model of the geoid, i.e. the Earth without its relief. Many geodetic ellipsoids exist. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.2.2, table 36 and annex B.3.2.3.
The class geosrs:geosrs:VerticalDatum is defined by the following:
Datum describing the relation of gravity-related heights or depths to the Earth. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 41 and annex B.3.3.
The class geosrs:geosrs:semiMajorAxis is defined by the following:
Indicates the length of the semi major axis of an ellipsoid. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 36, attribute length of semi-major axis.
The class geosrs:geosrs:semiMinorAxis is defined by the following:
Indicates the length of the semi minor axis of an ellipsoid. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 37, attribute length of semi-minor axis.
The class geosrs:geosrs:axis is defined by the following:
The property relates a coordinate system to one of its axis
The class geosrs:geosrs:baseCRS is defined by the following:
The geodetic coordinate reference system on which a projected coordinate reference system is based. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 11, association role baseCRS.
The class geosrs:geosrs:coordinateSystem is defined by the following:
The property relates a coordinate reference system to its coordinate system
The class geosrs:geosrs:datum is defined by the following:
The property relates a coordinate reference system to a datum
The class geosrs:geosrs:domainOfValidity is defined by the following:
Geographic area or time interval in which the referring object is valid. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 4, 33 and 42, attribute domainOfValidity.
The class geosrs:geosrs:ellipsoid is defined by the following:
The properties relates a datum to its ellipsoid definition
The class geosrs:geosrs:sourceCRS is defined by the following:
The coordinate reference system associated to the data used as input of a given operation. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 42, named association Source.
The class geosrs:geosrs:targetCRS is defined by the following:
The coordinate reference system associated to the data obtained as output of a given operation. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 42, named association Target.
This clause establishes the Co Requirements class, with IRI /req/co, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, Co, with IRI /conf/co.
The class geosrs:geosrs:derivingConversion is defined by the following:
The class geosrs:geosrs:method is defined by the following:
The class geosrs:geosrs:parameter is defined by the following:
This clause establishes the CS Requirements class, with IRI /req/cs, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, CS, with IRI /conf/cs.
The class geosrs:geosrs:axisDirection is defined by the following:
The direction of an axis. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 27, attribute coordinate system axis direction.
The class geosrs:geosrs:cylindricalCS is defined by the following:
Links a coordinate reference system to a cylindrical coordinate system
This clause establishes the Datum Requirements class, with IRI /req/datum, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, Datum, with IRI /conf/datum.
The class geosrs:geosrs:inverseFlattening is defined by the following:
Indicates the inverse flattening value of an ellipsoid, expressed as a number or a ratio (percentage rate, parts per million, etc.). Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 37, attribute inverse flattening
The class geosrs:geosrs:primeMeridian is defined by the following:
The prime meridian used by a geodetic datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 34, association role primeMeridian.
This clause establishes the SRSAPP Requirements class, with IRI /req/srsapp, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, SRSAPP, with IRI /conf/srsapp.
This clause establishes the PROJ Requirements class, with IRI /req/proj, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, PROJ, with IRI /conf/proj.
This clause establishes the PLANET Requirements class, with IRI /req/planet, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, PLANET, with IRI /conf/planet.

semantic__annex.semantic__p: The prefixes used for the ontologies mapped to in all following sections are given in the following table.

semantic__references.semantic__p: The following documents are referred to in the text in such a way that some or all of their content constitutes requirements of this document. For dated references, only the edition cited applies. For undated references, the latest edition of the referenced document (including any amendments) applies.

semantic__bibitem.semantic__formattedref: Identification of Common Molecular Subsequences. Smith, T.F., Waterman, M.S., J. Mol. Biol. 147, 195–197 (1981)

ZIB Structure Prediction Pipeline: Composing a Complex Biological Workflow through Web Services. May, P., Ehrlich, H.C., Steinke, T. In: Nagel, W.E., Walter, W.V., Lehner, W. (eds.) Euro-Par 2006. LNCS, vol. 4128, pp. 1148–1158. Springer, Heidelberg (2006)
The Grid: Blueprint for a New Computing Infrastructure., Foster, I., Kesselman, C.. Morgan Kaufmann, San Francisco (1999).

Grid Information Services for Distributed Resource Sharing. Czajkowski, K., Fitzgerald, S., Foster, I., Kesselman, C. In: 10th IEEE International Symposium on High Performance Distributed Computing, pp. 181–184. IEEE Press, New York (2001)
semantic__bibitem.semantic__docidentifier: Grid Information Services for Distributed Resource Sharing

semantic__note.semantic__p: The TC has approved Springer LNCS as the official document citation type. Springer LNCS is widely used in technical and computer science journals and other publications For citations in the text please use square brackets and consecutive numbers: [1], [2], [3] Actual References: [n] Journal: Author Surname, A.: Title. Publication Title. Volume number, Issue number, Pages Used (Year Published)

semantic__bibitem.semantic__abstract: ISO 19142:2010 specifies the behaviour of a web feature service that provides transactions on and access to geographic features in a manner independent of the underlying data store. It specifies discovery operations, query operations, locking operations, transaction operations and operations to manage stored parameterized query expressions.

semantic__bibitem.semantic__formattedref: W3C: Data Catalog Vocabulary, W3C Recommendation 16 January 2014,
W3C/OGC: Spatial Data on the Web Best Practices, W3C Working Group Note 28 September 2017,
W3C: Data on the Web Best Practices, W3C Recommendation 31 January 2017,
Ben-Kiki, O., Evans, C., Ingy döt Net: YAML Ain’t Markup Language,
Berners-Lee, T., Fielding, R., Masinter, L.: IETF RFC 3986 — Uniform Resource Identifier (URI): Generic Syntax,

note.p: Insert Preface Text here. Give OGC specific commentary: describe the technical content, reason for document, history of the document and precursors, and plans for future work.
There are two ways to specify the Preface: “simple clause” or “full clasuse”

If the Preface does not contain subclauses, it is considered a simple preface clause. This one is entered as text after the .Preface label and must be placed between the AsciiDoc document attributes and the first AsciiDoc section title. It should not be give a section title of its own.

If the Preface contains subclauses, it needs to be encoded as a full preface clause. This one is recognized as a full Metanorma AsciiDoc section with te title “Preface”, i.e. == Preface. (Simple preface content can also be encoded like full preface.)

terms.title: Terms and definitions
terms.p: This document uses the terms defined in OGC Policy Directive 49, which is based on the ISO/IEC Directives, Part 2, Rules for the structure and drafting of International Standards. In particular, the word “shall” (not “must”) is the verb form used to indicate a requirement to be strictly followed to conform to this document and OGC documents do not use the equivalent phrases in the ISO/IEC Directives, Part 2.

This document also uses terms defined in the OGC Standard for Modular specifications (OGC 08-131r3), also known as the ‘ModSpec’. The definitions of terms such as standard, specification, requirement, and conformance test are provided in the ModSpec.
For the purposes of this document, the following additional terms and definitions apply.

clause.p: The normative provisions in this standard are denoted by the URI
All requirements and conformance tests that appear in this document are denoted by partial URIs which are relative to this base.

clause.title: Other conventions
clause.p: <Place any other convention needed with its corresponding title>

clause.title: Core
clause.p: This clause establishes the Core Requirements class, with IRI /req/core, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, Core, with IRI /conf/core.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:CoordinateSystem
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:CoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
Set of axes that spans a given coordinate space and of mathematical rules for specifying how coordinates are to be assigned to points. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.2, table 17 and annex B.2.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:CartesianCoordinateSystem
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:CartesianCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
Coordinate system which gives the position of points relative to n mutually perpendicular axes. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 18.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:EllipsoidalCoordinateSystem
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:EllipsoidalCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
Coordinate system which gives the position is specified by geodetic latitude, geodetic longitude and (in the three-dimensional case) ellipsoidal height. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 20.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:LinearCoordinateSystem
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:LinearCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
One-dimensional coordinate system in which a linear feature forms the axis.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:OrdinalCoordinateSystem
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:OrdinalCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
n-dimensional coordinate system in which every axis uses integers.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:ParametricCoordinateSystem
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:ParametricCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
One-dimensional coordinate system where the axis units are parameter values which are not inherently spatial.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:PolarCoordinateSystem
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:PolarCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
Two-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by one distance coordinate and one angular coordinate.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:SphericalCoordinateSystem
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:SphericalCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
Three-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space with one distance measured from the origin and two angular coordinates

clause.title: Class: geosrs:VerticalCoordinateSystem
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:VerticalCoordinateSystem is defined by the following:
One-dimensional coordinate system used for gravity related height or depth measurements. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 25.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:CoordinateSystemAxis
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:CoordinateSystemAxis is defined by the following:
Axis relative to which a coordinate of a point is specified in a coordinate system. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.3, table 27 and annex B.2.2.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:AreaOfUse
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:AreaOfUse is defined by the following:

clause.title: Class: geosrs:CRS
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:CRS is defined by the following:

Depending on the spatial dimension of coordinates (1D, 2D, 3D), this piece of metadata is used for specifying the elements of definition associated to a given set of coordinates: its datum, its ellipsoid, its prime meridian, the type of coordinates (geocentric, geographic, projected,…​), the coordinates units of measure, when appropriate the cartographic projection used, the vertical coordinate reference system.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:EngineeringCRS
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:EngineeringCRS is defined by the following:

clause.title: Class: geosrs:GeodeticCRS
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:GeodeticCRS is defined by the following:
Coordinate reference system associated with a geodetic datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 8.2.2.a, table 10 and annex B.1.2.1.a.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:GeographicCRS
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:GeographicCRS is defined by the following:

clause.title: Class: geosrs:ProjectedCRS
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:ProjectedCRS is defined by the following:
Coordinate reference system derived from a two-dimensional geodetic coordinate reference system by applying a map projection. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 8.2.3.b, table 11 and annex B.1.2.3.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:SingleCRS
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:SingleCRS is defined by the following:
Coordinate reference system consisting of one coordinate system and one datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 5.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:SpatialReferenceSystem
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:SpatialReferenceSystem is defined by the following:
A reference system allowing the description of a position.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:CoordinateOperation
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:CoordinateOperation is defined by the following:

Mathematical operation on coordinates, based on one-to-one relationship, that changes coordinates from one coordinate reference system to another. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 11.1, table 42 and annex B.4.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:SingleOperation
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:SingleOperation is defined by the following:
A non concatenated coordinate operation. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 43.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:Transformation
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:Transformation is defined by the following:
Coordinate operation in which the two coordinate reference systems are based on different datums. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 44.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:Conversion
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:Conversion is defined by the following:
Coordinate operation in which both coordinate reference systems are based on the same datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 45 and annex B.4.2.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:OperationMethod
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:OperationMethod is defined by the following:
Method used to perform an operation on coordinates. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 48 and annex B.4.5.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:OperationParameter
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:OperationParameter is defined by the following:
Parameter used by a method to perform an operation on coordinates. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 52 and annex B.4.5.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:OperationParameterValue
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:OperationParameterValue is defined by the following:
Value of a parameter used by a method to perform an operation on coordinates. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 55.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:Datum
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:Datum is defined by the following:
Parameter or set of parameters that define the position of the origin, the scale and the orientation of a coordinate system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.1, table 33 and annex B.3.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:GeodeticDatum
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:GeodeticDatum is defined by the following:
Datum describing the relation of a two- or three-dimensional coordinate system to the Earth. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.2, table 34 and annex B.3.2.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:PrimeMeridian
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:PrimeMeridian is defined by the following:
Meridian from which the longitudes of other meridians are quantified. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.2.1, table 35 and annex B.3.2.2.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:Ellipsoid
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:Ellipsoid is defined by the following:

Surface formed by the rotation of an ellipse about its minor axis, defined by a semi-major axis and a flattening parameter and fairly geocentric. NB : It is a mathematical model of the geoid, i.e. the Earth without its relief. Many geodetic ellipsoids exist. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.2.2, table 36 and annex B.3.2.3.

clause.title: Class: geosrs:VerticalDatum
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:VerticalDatum is defined by the following:
Datum describing the relation of gravity-related heights or depths to the Earth. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 41 and annex B.3.3.

clause.title: Property: geosrs:semiMajorAxis
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:semiMajorAxis is defined by the following:
Indicates the length of the semi major axis of an ellipsoid. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 36, attribute length of semi-major axis.

clause.title: Property: geosrs:semiMinorAxis
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:semiMinorAxis is defined by the following:
Indicates the length of the semi minor axis of an ellipsoid. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 37, attribute length of semi-minor axis.

clause.title: Property: geosrs:axis
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:axis is defined by the following:
The property relates a coordinate system to one of its axis

clause.title: Property: geosrs:baseCRS
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:baseCRS is defined by the following:
The geodetic coordinate reference system on which a projected coordinate reference system is based. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 11, association role baseCRS.

clause.title: Property: geosrs:coordinateSystem
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:coordinateSystem is defined by the following:
The property relates a coordinate reference system to its coordinate system

clause.title: Property: geosrs:datum
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:datum is defined by the following:
The property relates a coordinate reference system to a datum

clause.title: Property: geosrs:domainOfValidity
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:domainOfValidity is defined by the following:
Geographic area or time interval in which the referring object is valid. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 4, 33 and 42, attribute domainOfValidity.

clause.title: Property: geosrs:ellipsoid
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:ellipsoid is defined by the following:
The properties relates a datum to its ellipsoid definition

clause.title: Property: geosrs:sourceCRS
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:sourceCRS is defined by the following:
The coordinate reference system associated to the data used as input of a given operation. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 42, named association Source.

clause.title: Property: geosrs:targetCRS
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:targetCRS is defined by the following:
The coordinate reference system associated to the data obtained as output of a given operation. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 42, named association Target.

clause.title: Coordinate Operation Module
clause.p: This clause establishes the Co Requirements class, with IRI /req/co, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, Co, with IRI /conf/co.

clause.title: Property: geosrs:derivingConversion
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:derivingConversion is defined by the following:

clause.title: Property: geosrs:method
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:method is defined by the following:

clause.title: Property: geosrs:parameter
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:parameter is defined by the following:

clause.title: Coordinate System Module
clause.p: This clause establishes the CS Requirements class, with IRI /req/cs, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, CS, with IRI /conf/cs.

clause.title: Property: geosrs:axisDirection
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:axisDirection is defined by the following:
The direction of an axis. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 27, attribute coordinate system axis direction.

clause.title: Property: geosrs:cylindricalCS
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:cylindricalCS is defined by the following:
Links a coordinate reference system to a cylindrical coordinate system

clause.title: Datum Module
clause.p: This clause establishes the Datum Requirements class, with IRI /req/datum, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, Datum, with IRI /conf/datum.

clause.title: Property: geosrs:inverseFlattening
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:inverseFlattening is defined by the following:
Indicates the inverse flattening value of an ellipsoid, expressed as a number or a ratio (percentage rate, parts per million, etc.). Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 37, attribute inverse flattening

clause.title: Property: geosrs:primeMeridian
clause.p: The class geosrs:geosrs:primeMeridian is defined by the following:
The prime meridian used by a geodetic datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 34, association role primeMeridian.

clause.title: SRS Application Module
clause.p: This clause establishes the SRSAPP Requirements class, with IRI /req/srsapp, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, SRSAPP, with IRI /conf/srsapp.

clause.title: Projections Module
clause.p: This clause establishes the PROJ Requirements class, with IRI /req/proj, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, PROJ, with IRI /conf/proj.

clause.title: Planet Module
clause.p: This clause establishes the PLANET Requirements class, with IRI /req/planet, which has a corresponding Conformance Class, PLANET, with IRI /conf/planet.

references.title: Normative references
references.p: The following documents are referred to in the text in such a way that some or all of their content constitutes requirements of this document. For dated references, only the edition cited applies. For undated references, the latest edition of the referenced document (including any amendments) applies.

The Grid: Blueprint for a New Computing Infrastructure., Foster, I., Kesselman, C.. Morgan Kaufmann, San Francisco (1999).

Grid Information Services for Distributed Resource Sharing. Czajkowski, K., Fitzgerald, S., Foster, I., Kesselman, C. In: 10th IEEE International Symposium on High Performance Distributed Computing, pp. 181–184. IEEE Press, New York (2001)

Springer LNCS is widely used in technical and computer science journals and other publications For citations in the text please use square brackets and consecutive numbers: [1], [2], [3] Actual References: [n] Journal: Author Surname, A.: Title. Publication Title. Volume number, Issue number, Pages Used (Year Published)
